The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in West Sussex so far as at 18 January is 31,214 (3,612.8 cases per 100,000 population). In the seven days to 13 January, there were 4,582 new confirmed cases (530.3 new cases per 100,000). In the seven days to 06 January, there were 5,778 new cases, and so the new cases have decreased by 21% (1,196 fewer cases).
